spirit:field.spirit:description: Bypass A0 in delay from A4

spirit:register.spirit:name: xcvr_psm_calin_tmr
spirit:register.spirit:description: PSM calibration in delay timer register

spirit:field.spirit:name: xcvr_psm_calin_tmr_9_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note, the smallest value this field is allowed to be is 12'h001. With that said, setting this field to a value smaller than the reset value will likely result in incorrect function.

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_txcc_lf_mult
spirit:register.spirit:description: LF multiplier value register

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_txcc_lf_mult_7_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: The output of the multiplier is 6 bits wide. It is possible to set the multiplier value here to a sufficiently large value to cause the multiplier result to be such that it can't be represented by a 6 bit value. In such a case, the multiplier output will be driven to 6'b111111.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_txcc_p4post_coef_mult_7_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: The output of the multiplier is 6 bits wide. It is possible to set the multiplier value here to a sufficiently large value to cause the multiplier result to be such that it can't be represented by a 6 bit value. In such a case, the multiplier output will be driven to 6'b111111.

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_txcc_p5post_coef_mult
spirit:register.spirit:description: Preset 5 post emphasis coefficient multiplier value register

It is possible to set the multiplier value here to a sufficiently large value to cause the multiplier result to be such that it can't be represented by a 6 bit value. In such a case, the multiplier output will be driven to 6'b111111.

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_txcc_ipost_coef_value
spirit:register.spirit:description: Init post emphasis coefficient value register

spirit:register.spirit:name: xcvr_diag_pwri_tmr
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transceiver power island control timer register

spirit:field.spirit:name: xcvr_diag_pwri_tmr_12_8
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: A value of 0 in this field is not valid, and will result in a delay of 1 clock cycle. Note: The value of this field must be the same for all lanes that make up a link.

spirit:field.spirit:name: xcvr_diag_pwri_tmr_4_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: A value of 0 in this field is not valid, and will result in a delay of 1 clock cycle. Note: The value of this field must be the same for all lanes that make up a link.

spirit:register.spirit:name: xcvr_diag_xcal_pwri_ovrd
spirit:register.spirit:description: Note: This register must not be part of any register read write test where patterns other than those described in this register are written to this register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: xcvr_diag_xcal_pwri_ovrd_7_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: The value of this field must be the same for all lanes that make up a link.

spirit:register.spirit:name: xcvr_diag_xcal_pwri_stat
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transceiver transceiver calibration power island control status register

spirit:register.spirit:name: xcvr_diag_xdp_pwri_ovrd
spirit:register.spirit:description: Note: This register must not be part of any register read write test where patterns other than those described in this register are written to this register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: xcvr_diag_xdp_pwri_stat
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transceiver transceiver data path power island control status register

spirit:register.spirit:name: xcvr_diag_plldrc_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transceiver PLL data rate clock control register

spirit:register.spirit:name: xcvr_diag_hsclk_sel
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transceiver high speed clock select register

spirit:register.spirit:name: xcvr_diag_hsclk_div
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transceiver high speed clock divider register

spirit:field.spirit:name: xcvr_diag_hsclk_div_3_2
spirit:field.spirit:description: Default value = 2' h01 when in USB3

spirit:field.spirit:name: xcvr_diag_hsclk_div_1_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Default value = 2' h10 when in USB3

spirit:register.spirit:name: xcvr_diag_txclk_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: TX clock control register

spirit:register.spirit:name: xcvr_diag_rxclk_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: RX clock control register

spirit:register.spirit:name: xcvr_diag_bidi_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transceiver control register

spirit:field.spirit:name: xcvr_diag_bidi_ctrl_1
spirit:field.spirit:description: txda_lane_skew_sel : use when in DP low speed mode

spirit:register.spirit:name: xcvr_diag_psc_ovrd
spirit:register.spirit:description: Power state controller override register

spirit:register.spirit:name: xcvr_diag_rst_diag
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transceiver control reset diagnostic register

spirit:field.spirit:name: xcvr_diag_rst_diag_2
spirit:field.spirit:description: Current state of the tx_coef_calc_reset_n reset.

spirit:field.spirit:name: xcvr_diag_rst_diag_1
spirit:field.spirit:description: Current state of the xcvr_psm_reset_n reset.

spirit:field.spirit:name: xcvr_diag_rst_diag_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Current state of the xcvr_ref_clk_reset_n reset.

spirit:register.spirit:name: xcvr_diag_xcvr_clk_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transceiver clock reset control register

spirit:register.spirit:name: xcvr_diag_enb_ana_dcd_test
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transceiver embedded analog decoder test register

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_psc_a0
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transmitter A0 power state definition register

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_psc_a0_11
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX driver common mode enable extend control

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_psc_a0_10
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This function is implemented for additional power savings. In the analog, this signal controls a MUX select associated with the driver. Setting this bit to 1'b1 will force the MUX to select the LFPS data path. By selecting this path in low power states, instead of the serializer path, the driver inputs will be driven to 1'b0, instead of having the potential to toggle.

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_psc_a1
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transmitter A1 power state definition register

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_psc_a1_11
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX driver common mode enable extend control

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_psc_a2
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transmitter A2 power state definition register

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_psc_a2_11
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX driver common mode enable extend control

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_psc_a3
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transmitter A3 power state definition register

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_psc_a3_11
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX driver common mode enable extend control

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_psc_a4
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transmitter A4 power state definition register

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_psc_a4_11
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX driver common mode enable extend control

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_psc_a5
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transmitter A5 power state definition register

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_psc_a5_11
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX driver common mode enable extend control

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_psc_cal
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transmitter calibration power state definition register

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_psc_cal_11
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX driver common mode enable extend control

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_psc_rdy
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transmitter ready power state definition register

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_psc_rdy_11
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX driver common mode enable extend control

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_rcvdet_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transmit receiver detect control register

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_rcvdet_ctrl_15
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This bit is intended to be for diagnostics purposes only. The receiver detect process must not be under the control of the top level tx_rcv_detect_en pin when attempting to initiate the process using this register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_rcvdet_ctrl_14
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This bit is intended to be for diagnostics purposes only.

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_rcvdet_ovrd
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transmit receiver detect override register

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_rcvdet_en_tmr
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transmit receiver detect enable timer register

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_rcvdet_st_tmr
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transmit receiver detect start timer register

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_bist_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: Note: This register is on the diagnostic power island, and cannot be written to when this power island is switched off.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_bist_ctrl_1
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note : This clear function simply resets the FIFO pointers. It does not clear the contents of the FIFO.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_bist_ctrl_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note : The remaining bits in this register must be stable when changing this bit. Therefore, it is best to enable and disable this function using a read / modify / write of this bit.

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_bist_uddwr
spirit:register.spirit:description: Note: This register is on the diagnostic power island, and cannot be written to when this power island is switched off.

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_bist_seed0
spirit:register.spirit:description: Note: This register is on the diagnostic power island, and cannot be written to when this power island is switched off.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_bist_seed0_2_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This register field must never be all 0s.

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_bist_seed1
spirit:register.spirit:description: Note: This register is on the diagnostic power island, and cannot be written to when this power island is switched off.

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_duty_cycle_cal_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: TX duty cycle calibration control register

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_duty_cycle_cal_ctrl_14
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: Three cmn_ref_clk cycles are required after the start of the calibration process to clear this signal.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_duty_cycle_cal_ctrl_13
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: Due to the nature of the calibration process, it is not possible to determine if the analog responded or not for the lowest code of 5'b10001. The reason for this is, when sequencing to lower codes, the calibration function is looking for the analog response to transition from 1'b1 to 1'b0. If the lowest calibration code is the correct code, the analog will respond with 1'b1, and the algorithm can't sequence to a lower code to look for the transition from 1'b1 to 1'b0. Similarly, if the analog is not responding, it is not possible to sequence to a lower code to detect this. Therefore, even when the calibration function selects this calibration code as valid, this bit will be set.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_duty_cycle_cal_ctrl_6_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: The reset value for this field is with the common calibration power island switched off. In cases where this power island is switched on, the reset value be 7'b1000000.

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_duty_cycle_cal_ovrd
spirit:register.spirit:description: TX duty cycle calibration override register

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_duty_cycle_cal_ovrd_15
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: The value of this field must not be changed while the calibration function is running.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_duty_cycle_cal_ovrd_14
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: The value of this field must not be changed while the calibration function is running.

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_duty_cycle_cal_start
spirit:register.spirit:description: TX duty cycle calibration start register

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_duty_cycle_cal_start_6_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note that this is always a positive number,from 2 to 127.

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_duty_cycle_cal_tune
spirit:register.spirit:description: TX duty cycle calibration tune register

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_duty_cycle_cal_tune_5_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This value is a twos complement value, so the calibrated code can be increased or decreased.

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_duty_cycle_cal_init_tmr
spirit:register.spirit:description: TX duty cycle calibration initialization timer register

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_duty_cycle_cal_init_tmr_8_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This results in the minimum number of tx_dc_cal_clk clocks required to wait 5 uSec. Note: This should never be set to a value of less than 1.

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_duty_cycle_cal_iter_tmr
spirit:register.spirit:description: TX duty cycle calibration iteration timer register

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_duty_cycle_cal_iter_tmr_11_9
spirit:field.spirit:description: DC calibration act range : This signal will drive txda_dc_cal_act_range[2:0] to analog configuration
